snippet: Facing a tighter job market, employee turnover and scrutiny of its labor practices, the retailer plans to increase pay for a half-million workers.
abstract: Walmart says it will raise wages for half-million of its employees to minimum of $9 per hour by April and at least $10 by February 2016; changes come as company faces scrutiny for its labor practices, and as much-improved job market has made it difficult for them to maintain high rate of employee turnover; labor advocates say increase is insufficient.
lead_paragraph: Facing a tighter job market, employee turnover and scrutiny of its labor practices, the retailer plans to increase pay for a half-million workers.

headline.main: Walmart Raising Wage to at Least $9
headline.print_headline: Walmart Lifts Its Wage Floor to $9 an Hour
